Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, de novo designed, man-made sequences

Literature.Author: Wang C, Shao C, Fang Y, Wang J, Dong N, Shan A. 2021
Literature.Title: Binding loop of sunflower trypsin inhibitor 1 serves as a design motif for proteolysis-resistant antimicrobial peptides.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (77.78%) toRI2L=R: 22%; I=C=P: 11%.  GRAVY: 0.183; M Wt:  2168.709; Mol formula:  C96H167N32O21S2; molar extinction coeff: 5675.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 or UB1005 or K88 or K99 strains (MIC 2-16 uM), S. pullorum 7913 (MIC 2 uM),  S. enterica serovar Typhimurium C7731 or 14208 (MIC 16 uM), P. aeruginosa 27853 (MIC 16 uM), S. choleraesuis CVCC503 (MIC 16 uM), S. aureus ATCC 29213 or 29523 (MIC 32-64 uM), S. epidermidis 12228 (MIC 32 uM), and E. faecalis 29212 (MIC 32 uM).Antimicrobial robustness:  NaCl-sensitive:E. coli (150 mM salt); KCl-insensitive:E. coli (4.5 mM salt); NH4Cl-insensitive:E. coli (6 uM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:E. coli (1 mM salt); CaCl2-sensitive:E. coli (2 mM salt); ZnCl2-insensitive:E. coli (8 uM salt); FeCl3-insensitive:E. coli (4 uM salt); NaCl-sensitive:S. aureus (150 mM salt); KCl-insensitive:S. aureus (4.5 mM salt); NH4Cl-insensitive:S. aureus (6 uM salt); MgCl2-sensitive:S. aureus (1 mM salt); CaCl2-sensitive:S. aureus (2 mM salt); ZnCl2-insensitive:S. aureus (8 uM salt); FeCl3-insensitive:S. aureus (4 uM salt).Toxicity: 10% hemolysis concentration > 128 uM (poor hemo.lytic).
